tools.name: listTables
tools.description: Search and list NetSuite record types/tables with their IDs and labels. Use this to discover available data structures in the account.

limit.description: Maximum number of tables to return (e.g., '50'). Leave empty for all results. Examples of highly-used tables: 'transaction', 'transactionline', 'customer', 'item', 'inventorybalance'.

search.description: Filter tables by searching in ID or label (case-insensitive). Examples: 'customer', 'inventory', 'account', 'employee', 'location', 'subsidiary', 'itemprice', 'supportcase'.

tools.name: getTableSchema
tools.description: Get complete field schema and structure for a specific NetSuite table. Use after finding a table ID with listTables.

id.description: NetSuite table ID (verify first with listTables). Common examples: 'transaction' (all transactions), 'transactionline' (line items), 'customer' (customer master), 'item' (item master), 'inventorybalance' (current stock by location), 'employee', 'account', 'location', 'subsidiary', 'itemprice', 'supportcase'.
